cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi (25 km) south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf, then turning northwest toward the northwest Gulf Coast (Texas–Louisiana border area) late Wednesday and early Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Gulf Coast near the Texas–Louisiana border (between Port Arthur, TX and Lake Charles, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for U.S. Gulf Coast as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwest Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast to south-central Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely; hurricane-force gusts possible if the center tracks farther west
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge 3–6 ft along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and Texas City Channel
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals near 12 inches possible, leading to flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and the potential for isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands
